item.title: Skyrim
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

You don’t get to keep the skeleton key in this game though, just do the quest up until when you get it and don’t return it if you want to keep it.

Stamina improves carry weight, as well as a couple of perks, and theives guild armour.

Read full topic

item.title: Skyrim
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Gold shouldn’t be a problem, I have over 100k on both my chars with less than a day play time on each.

Alchemy, enchanting and pickpocketing are my tried and tested money makers.

item.title: Skyrim
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:64, topic:421207”][quote author=John459 link=topic=523871.msg3831724#msg3831724 date=1322622747]

The problem is I have a shit ton of dragon bones and scales and they’re taking up my inventory weight. So looting isn’t my best option here. Is there any other sort of storage around?

Get someone to follow you and hand your heavy items over to them.
[/quote]
I’ll have them dead in less than 2 minutes. Then where would I be[/quote]

Mjoll the Lioness will follow you if you do a quest for her, and, since she is considered an important npc, she cannot die.

Read full topic

item.title: Skyrim
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:

Greeny:

EG, if a dragon attacks whiterun and you’ve left some weapons on the floor people will grab them and equip to attack the dragon more effectively. The AI is probably the biggest improvement they’ve made tbh.

what you talking about, npcs picking up items for battles was in fo3 at least

everyones talking about all these great features and most of them have been in previous bethesda games, it’s quite surprising

Read full topic

item.title: Skyrim
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

It stays but watch out for citizens of skyrim taking it, go somewhere remote.

EG, if a dragon attacks whiterun and you’ve left some weapons on the floor people will grab them and equip to attack the dragon more effectively. The AI is probably the biggest improvement they’ve made tbh.

Read full topic

item.title: Skyrim
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Frell:

Who gives a fuck? Seriously, the points is for it to be immersive and have no grind. Of course powerleveling wont be a bitch.

Huh? I think you misinterpreted my post, I was simply answering a question on how to level fast, one thing I certainly do not want is a grind. I mentioned it’s really easy to level because compared to oblivion and morrowind; it is.

That said, TES games tend to be played best with “natural” levelling. However the console commands have always been there for people to use if they cba.

Read full topic

item.title: Skyrim
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Just do side quests for cash. I was annoyed that a house cost 5k gold as I only had 1k at the time and that had taken me ages but after I started visiting a few more dungeons I had 5k in no time. Just pick up the best loot you can then sell it that’s how I’ve done it.

There’s probably a faster way to make money but I dunno

Read full topic

item.title: Skyrim
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:54, topic:421207”]Conjuration <3
Such a shame my level is so low, any tips for speeding up levelling it?[/quote]

Power levelling in this game is so easy, and almost silly.

Conjuration: kill an enemy cast soul trap dual handed continuously. If you are high elf use highborn to really speed up the process. Otherwise you can just wait an hour after you use up magicka to replenish it to full.

Read full topic

item.title: Skyrim
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:54, topic:421207”]Conjuration <3
Such a shame my level is so low, any tips for speeding up levelling it?[/quote]
cast soul trap on corpses, or repeatedly cast bound weapon near slaughterfish where they can’t attack you… also i think killing your familiars with bound weapons
personally i just raid dungeons with my flame atronach/undead i’ve raised

Read full topic

Glitch behind a rock on top of a hill and cast spells at mammoths. Lol make sure they get stuck between those rocks or it doesn’t work
